p: Serologies for coxsackie virus, rubella, Chagas disease, human immunodeficiency virus, cytomegalovirus, Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), toxoplasmosis, hepatitis B virus and hepatitis C virus were negative. The patientâ€™s serum samples were tested and found to be ELISA-IgM positive and ELISA-IgG positive for DENV and ELISA-IgM positive for CHIKV. The DENV NS1 antigen test yielded a negative result. There was a good response to therapy and the patient progressed with gradual improvement until recovery of ventricular function. After 11 days, a last echocardiogram showed an EF of 70% and persistence of pericardial effusion. The patient was discharged from the hospital 11 days after admission.
